oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Weed control strategies in organically grown carrots
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Turner, Rebecca J
Grundy, Andrea C
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Weed management
Crop husbandry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper outlines a study to integrate elements of cultural, thermal and mechanical control methods in the production of late maincrop drilled organic carrots. Agronomic and economic findings are discussed
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Organic Centre Wales, Institute of Rural Studies, University of Wales Aberystwyth
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Turner, Rebecca J and Grundy, Andrea C (2002) Weed control strategies in organically grown carrots. In: Powell, Jane and et al., (Eds.) Proceedings of the UK Organic Research 2002 Conference, Organic Centre Wales, Institute of Rural Studies, University of Wales Aberystwyth, pp. 229-230.
